title: Nvidia, a titan of microchips facing the first doubts about AI
summary: The Californian company, which dominates the market, is facing questions from investors wondering whether it is profitable enough, and competition from its own clients including Google, Amazon, Microsoft and Tesla.

title: French police arrests suspect in synagogue attack
summary: The country's interior minister, Gérald Darmanin, said on X that 'the suspected perpetrator of the criminal fires at the synagogue has been detained'. Two cars parked at the Beth Yaacov synagogue complex in La Grande Motte in southern France were set ablaze Saturday morning, injuring a police officer.

title: In historic Kyiv visit, India's Modi seeks to restore his image with the West
summary: The Indian prime minister's visit to Kyiv and Warsaw shows his desire to rebalance a diplomatic approach which, until now, has been heavily oriented towards Moscow.

title: Israeli airstrikes kill dozens in Gaza on the eve of high-level ceasefire talks in Egypt
summary: Among the victims are eleven memebrs of the same family, including two children. Meanwhile talks between US officials and Egyptian and Qatari mediators are expected to take place in Cairo on Sunday.

title: Film legend Alain Delon buried near his dogs in private funeral
summary: The famed actor was laid to rest on Saturday in a funeral attended by his children, relatives and close friends at his estate in Douchy, central France.

title: China's piano market is collapsing, reflecting the concerns of the middle class
summary: Once flourishing, piano sales in China fell sharply in 2024, against a backdrop of economic stagnation. In Luoshe, the Chinese capital of the prestigious instrument, manufacturers are feeling the impact.

title: Telegram chief Pavel Durov arrested at French airport: officials
summary: According to TF1/LCI the billionaire was arrested as he exited his private jet shortly after his arrival in Paris.

title: German police make second arrest as Islamic State group claims responsibility for deadly knife attack
summary: Three people were killed in the attack in the city of Solingen. Police have not revealed whether the two detained persons were directly involved in the incident.

title: Gold continues to soar, after the US opens the door to a rate cut in September
summary: The weakening dollar, a consequence of the rate cut announced for September in the US, is causing gold to break records. This trend is reinforced by the instability in the Middle East.

title: War in Ukraine: Secret talks between Moscow and Kyiv disrupted by Kursk offensive
summary: Confidential negotiations between Kyiv and Moscow, under the aegis of Qatar, were being conducted to obtain a partial ceasefire. This was interrupted by the offensive in Kursk.

title: Kamala Harris sticks to Biden's line on Gaza, disappointing pro-Palestinian left
summary: Pro-Palestinian activists from the Uncommitted movement were virtually sidelined at the Democratic convention, although they were able to establish contacts with leaders.

title: Iranian hackers step up interference operations ahead of US elections
summary: The activity of Iranian hackers, who had already attacked the 2020 election campaign, is not new. However, it has been on the rise since last year.

title: A new portrait of Paris in maps, from below ground to its iconic zinc roofs
summary: A new atlas reveals little-known aspects of the capital and the changes it has undergone in recent decades. It also sheds light on the origins of its residents and how they live together.

title: NASA extends Boeing Starliner astronauts’ Space Station stay to 2025
summary: Two US astronauts who arrived at the International Space Station aboard Boeing's Starliner will have to return home with rival SpaceX, NASA said Saturday.

title: Rodin Museum sets course for China
summary: In September, a Chinese collector will open a museum dedicated to the French sculptor in partnership with the Parisian establishment.

title: Paris Paralympics flame is lit and begins journey from England to France
summary: British Paralympians Helene Raynsford and Gregor Ewan lit the flame on Saturday in Stoke Mandeville, a village northwest of London widely considered the birthplace of the Paralympic Games.

title: Kyiv and Moscow announce prisoner of war swap on Ukraine's independence day
summary: The warring parties announced the exchange of 230 prisoners on Saturday, just over two weeks into Ukraine's surprise offensive on Kursk.

title: Struggling Donald Trump welcomes Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s campaign endorsement
summary: A controversial member of America's most famous political family, the independent candidate was never able to build momentum and finally dropped out of the presidential race on Friday.
